org.trianacode.gui.hci.color

Interface ColorModel

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    BackgroundColorModel, CableColorModel, NodeColorModel, RegisterableColorModel
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    DaxColorModel, IWIRColorModel, ScriptColorModel, ShiwaColorModel, TrianaColorModel

    public interface ColorModel
    An interface used to link colors in the ColorTable with graphical elements.

    When a ColorModel is first created it should populate the ColorTable with default colors for each of the color names it uses (note this should be done using the initDefaultColor method in the ColorTable, not setColor).

    When the getColor method is called the ColorModel should retrieve the color it associates with the specified graphical element from the ColorTable via its color name.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.awt.Color getColor(java.lang.String element) 
      java.awt.Color getColor(java.lang.String element, Tool tool)

      java.lang.String[] getElementNames() 
      java.lang.String getModelName() 

    • Method Detail

      • getModelName

        java.lang.String getModelName()
        Returns:
        the name of this Color model

      • getColorNames

        java.lang.String[] getColorNames()
        Returns:
        the color names that this model uses. These are linked to actual colors by querying the color table.

      • getElementNames

        java.lang.String[] getElementNames()
        Returns:
        the element names this color model links with color names

      • getColor

        java.awt.Color getColor(java.lang.String element,
                      Tool tool)
        Returns:
        the color for the specified graphical element when representing the specified tool. If the element is unrecognized this method will return a default color.

      • getColor

        java.awt.Color getColor(java.lang.String element)
        Returns:
        the color for the specified graphical element not linked to a specific tool. If the element is unrecognized this method will return a default color.
